project.logic

Class GraphGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • project.logic.GraphGenerator

  • public class GraphGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is created to generate random task graphs to load them to the computer systems with different topologies.
    Author:
    Yaroslav

    • Constructor Summary

      GraphGenerator(int minW, int maxW, int nodesNumber, double correlation, int minL, int maxL, int graphsNumber, RandomGraphPanel randomGraphPanel, javax.swing.JTextArea console)
      Main constructor.

      Generates single graph using input parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphGenerator

        public GraphGenerator(int minW,
              int maxW,
              int nodesNumber,
              double correlation,
              int minL,
              int maxL,
              int graphsNumber,
              RandomGraphPanel randomGraphPanel,
              javax.swing.JTextArea console)
        Main constructor.
        Parameters:
        minW - minimum graph node weight
        maxW - maximum graph node weight
        nodesNumber - number of nodes in the graph
        correlation - specified correlation of the graph
        minL - minimum transition weight
        maxL - maximum transition weight
        graphsNumber - number of graphs for modeling
        randomGraphPanel - a pointer to the random graph panel
        console - a pointer to the console object

      • generateMultipleGraphs

        public void generateMultipleGraphs(ComputerSystem comSys)
        This method is used to discover the efficiency of the different computer system topologies scaling on the large amount of random task graphs. Output parameters: 1. Kp - acceleration factor. 2. Ke - effectiveness ratio. 3. Kea - effectiveness ratio of algorithm.
        Parameters:
        comSys - computer system to model
